Articles.Content: Never noticed a problem like that, so maybe give it a go....

I really didnt want to test anymore decouplers slashed down on kerbin so this looks promising. Thanks [@iamchairs](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143189-iamchairs/) and [@TheDog](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/137239-thedog/)
Can anyone confirm that this works for 1.1.3?

> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, Qwarkk said:
> 
> 
> Can anyone confirm that this works for 1.1.3?
> 

[https://github.com/TheDogKSP/StateFunding/releases/tag/0.4.2-KSP1.1.3](https://github.com/TheDogKSP/StateFunding/releases/tag/0.4.2-KSP1.1.3)

He did a 1.1.3 version just a day ago actually. ~~Haven't tested it myself yet, but I will shortly.~~

**Edit:**

Well I loaded it up and got the "Choose a Gov't Screen" and the Reviews and Overview screen. So far the 1.1.3 version linked above seems to be working.

[@TheDog](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/137239-thedog/) You still undecided about becoming maintainer?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-19T02:44:44Z" title="07/19/2016 02:44  AM" data-short="7 yr">July 19, 2016</time> by Deimos Rast**

Yes, sorry, I did the upgrade mainly for myself, forgot to mention it here....

Yes, everything should be working under 1.1.3.

For being an official maintainer I seriously lack the time & dedication, I am sorry. Still hoping [@iamchairs](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/143189-iamchairs/) will continue the development... But dont worry: since I use it myself, I have an interest in keeping this working ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Anyone desperately looking for this to be updated to 1.2?

I have decided I will no longer use it in my save, as there are better alternatives (contracts, funding mods) out there.

However, if someone desperately depends on this I'd give it a shot to compile it for 1.2.

Alright, here you go:

[https://github.com/TheDogKSP/StateFunding/releases/tag/0.5.0](https://github.com/TheDogKSP/StateFunding/releases/tag/0.5.0)

It was a bit more than a recompile, since the load order of addons and scenariomodules changed, which screwed up some internal logic. I \*hope\* it works reliably without nullref exceptions...

[@TheDog](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/137239-thedog/) Are you still looking for someone to take over this mod?

> 
>

> 
> 
> [@TheDog](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/137239-thedog/) Are you still looking for someone to take over this mod?
> 

Hi Linuxguru,

Sure, if you'd like to take over  wouldn't mind, indeed I'd be happy about it!

Use my repo as base.

Are you planning to make this a part of the Krash mod?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, TheDog said:
>

> Hi Linuxguru,
>

It doesn't belong with KRASH.

A long time ago, I made a post looking for a Govfunding mod, was (at the time) pointed to the CIT - govfund mod.  That one is long gone, and this looks better.  So I'll fork your repo, recompile, make my normal changes to any mod I adopt (logging, putting version info into dll, etc) and release it in a day or so in an official version.

In the repo, I see you have quite a number of branches.  I assume the master branch is current?  Is there anything in those other branches that may be something under development?

thanks

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-24T11:40:17Z" title="02/24/2017 11:40  AM" data-short="7 yr">February 24, 2017</time> by linuxgurugamer**

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/lk1tcqdwkdvfrkd/StateFunding-0.6.0.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/lk1tcqdwkdvfrkd/StateFunding-0.6.0.zip?dl=0)

Source is on Github as usual.

Master is current, the rest is old stuff (99% from IAMCHAIRS), nothing in there that you'd need to consider.

But before you pour too much work into this, have a look at this up-to-date and maintained mod:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/147010-122-monthly-budgets-25-06012017/&do=embed"></iframe>

I feel it somewhat extends on the scope of StateFunding, and maybe even does things better (though StateFunding is the simpler solution overall)...

> I feel it somewhat extends on the scope of StateFunding, and maybe even does things better (though StateFunding is the simpler solution overall)...

Interesting, I'll have to look at it.

I wasn't a fan of "disable contract payouts" in Monthly Budgets, so I wasn't that interested in the MB mod.

(but I see that is now tweakable in v2.0)
It would be very interesting to compare State Funding to Monthly Budgets, side by side.  They both look good, and solve similar issues

I play with monthly budgets and it seems like state funding has a pretty different model to me. Where as monthly budgets pays you for reputation, but subtracts costs for active missions and kerbals (both assigned and at the complex), state funding seems to actually pay you for how many missions you have active, which is quite a bit different. If this comes back online, I'll be torn about which one to use for that reason. I do think they're complementary and don't overlap in their funding model. Although I haven't played with state funding in a long time...

New release after adoption here:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/156984-12-state-funding-continued/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/156984-12-state-funding-continued/)

Please move all conversations over there.

Thanks

I wonder if both can work together, maybe with some tweaking?
This thread is now closed as it looks like iamchairs is not coming back.
